message.content:
cs.DM, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.GT, cs.NI

Reasoning: The paper discusses the modeling of networks using higher-dimensional structures such as hypergraphs and simplicial complexes, which are commonly studied in the subfield of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also discusses the transformation of hypergraphs into simplicial complexes, which falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG) and topological data analysis (cs.SI). The paper also mentions the modeling of broadcasting networks, which is related to network information theory (cs.IT) and network science (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the applications of these ideas, which could fall under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC) or social and information networks (cs.SI). Overall, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DM, cs.SI, and cs.SD, followed by cs.GT and cs.NI.
